summary.Title: Technical Superintendent
summary.Presentation: For the offshore activities in FLC Marine, we are looking for a skilled and dedicated Technical Superintendent for the vessels which is going to be involved in operation in the foreshore between De

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
For the offshore activities in FLC Marine, we are looking for a skilled and dedicated Technical Superintendent for the vessels which is going to be involved in operation in the foreshore between Denmark and Germany.

Who is FLC?

Femern Link Contractors, FLC, is the joint venture responsible for the design and construction of the Northern Europe’s biggest construction project resulting in the longest immersed tunnel in the world. Our joint venture consists of nine international construction companies with individual experience in large infrastructure projects. Together, we are committed to working together to deliver a state-of-the-art immersed tunnel, portals, and ramps, delivered on time and safely, in a sustainable and ethical manner.

The role of Vessel Technical Superintendent entails the technical management of vessels deployed on our project. Candidates must possess solid experience in various duties related to technical vessel management in offshore/marine contracting or the oil & gas industry. The role involves interaction with flag and class authorities, overseeing planned maintenance systems (PMS), and managing dockings and repairs afloat.

Main responsibilities (but not limited to):

  • Manage the technical aspects of vessels deployed on the project.
  • Liaise with flag and class authorities to ensure compliance with regulations.
  • Oversee planned maintenance systems (PMS) to ensure optimal vessel performance.
  • Coordinate dockings and repairs afloat to maintain vessel integrity and functionality.
  • Provide technical expertise and support to project teams as needed.

Qualifications / Experience:

  • Proven experience as a Technical Superintendent in offshore/marine contracting or the oil & gas industry.
  • Familiarity with flag and class requirements.
  • Proficiency in planned maintenance systems (PMS).
  • Experience with dockings and repairs afloat.
  • Preferred experience in heavy lift/lift-systems, dredging/winch systems, and mobilizations or conversions.
  • Knowledge of the maritime market in North-West Europe.

Preference will be given to candidates with experience in heavy lift/lift-systems, dredging/winch systems, mobilizations or conversions, and familiarity with the maritime market in North-West Europe. Additionally, candidates must be prepared to work full-time onshore in Denmark for the project duration.

Conditions for employment:

FLC considers transparent management structures, short decision-making channels, and a team-oriented environment to be extremely important. Our staff is expected to set themselves targets, achieve them independently, and take responsibility for their actions – irrespective of their position in the company.

Work location:

Based in Rødbyhavn.

Does it sound like you?

Then, we look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We will handle the applications on an ongoing basis, and we will end the recruitment process when we have found the right person.

For HR related questions, please contact Marine Crew department on +45 29 64 39 22.
